au.com.permeance.liferay.spring
Class BeanLocatorDefinitionCopier

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.context.support.ApplicationObjectSupport
      au.com.permeance.liferay.spring.BeanLocatorDefinitionCopier
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware
public class BeanLocatorDefinitionCopier
extends org.springframework.context.support.ApplicationObjectSupport

This class provides a bean which registers existing liferay beans obtained from liferay's BeanLocator in the Spring ApplicationContext in which the instance of this class is defined. Bean inclusions and exclusions can be specified using the addIncludeFilter(TypeFilter) and addExcludeFilter(TypeFilter) methods. Exclusions take priority of inclusions.

initApplicationContext

protected final void initApplicationContext(org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext context)
Initialises the supplied application context based on the BeanLocator associated with this instance by iterating the liferay registered beans (via BeanLocator.getNames()).

Overrides:
initApplicationContext in class org.springframework.context.support.ApplicationObjectSupport
Parameters:
context - the ConfigurableApplicationContext in which beans should be registered (by calling ConfigurableApplicationContext.getBeanFactory()).

safeLocate

protected final Object safeLocate(String name)
Calls BeanLocator.locate(String) on the beanLocator associated with this instance, catching and logging any BeanLocatorException which is thrown.

Parameters:
name - the name of the bean to locate.
Returns:
the instance of the specified bean if it exists, or null if a BeanLocatorException is thrown.

isAcceptable

protected final boolean isAcceptable(String type)
Determines whether the class identified by the supplied string is acceptable for copying by this instance. Acceptance is based on (in order):
  1. The string identifying a known type (if the type is unknown, it is unacceptable)
  2. Which does not match an exclude filter (if the type is excluded, it is unacceptable)
  3. Which matches any defined include filters (if the type is included, it is acceptable)
  4. Or if no include filter is defined, it is acceptable

Parameters:
type - the type of class to match.
Returns:
true if the type matches the acceptance criteria for this class, false otherwise.

matches

protected final boolean matches(Collection<? extends org.springframework.core.type.filter.TypeFilter> filters,
                                Class<?> clazz)
Checks whether the supplied class matches any of the supplied type filters, returning true if it does, false otherwise.

Parameters:
filters - the filters to match against.
clazz - the class to match.
Returns:
true if any of the filters match, false otherwise.

safeMatch

protected final boolean safeMatch(org.springframework.core.type.filter.TypeFilter filter,
                                  org.springframework.core.type.classreading.MetadataReader metadataReader)
Wraps a call to TypeFilter.match(MetadataReader, org.springframework.core.type.classreading.MetadataReaderFactory) so that any IOException is logged rather than propagating up the call stack. Returns the result of the match if successful, false otherwise.

Parameters:
filter - the filter to match against.
metadataReader - the metadata reader to match with.
Returns:
true if TypeFilter.match(MetadataReader, org.springframework.core.type.classreading.MetadataReaderFactory) returns it, false otherwise.

safeForName

protected final Class<?> safeForName(String className)
Wraps a call to Class.forName(String) so that any ClassNotFoundException is logged rather than propagating back up the call stack. Returns the specified class if successful, or null otherwise.

Parameters:
className - the name of the class to resolve.
Returns:
the requested class, if available, or null.
